marklogic.body:
Shock boot again? Oh no! That can only mean a good singer will be leaving and Heejun will stay on.
I have given Phillip credit for his unique sound and artistry, but honestly it's not happening for me. It could just be his singing style. I think he sounds the same in every performance. I guess MJ has it right since he seems to be very popular and has that appeal, WGWG and all. It's just depressing to see this happen every season lately.
I think I had Elise higher than MJ last week. I think she may be connecting with her good song choices. This performance last night was absolutely freakin' amazing! I would keep Jessica at the#2 Spot. I guess Colton is another one that I just do not get. I think he sucks the life out of his songs. He had some real vocal problems at the beginning and end of his performance. I wonder if the whole Christian thing will help or hurt. I guess he deserves to be up near the top.
I feel like Skylar may be losing steam. It's true that she is the only country singer, but her song choices haven't done her any favors. She is a strong performer with confidence and great stage presence, but I think she is slipping a little. I guess it's okay to keep her in the #5 Spot.
Deandre is mid-pack. He has been struggling to find the right song and make it work. I thought his performance last night was his best since "Master Blaster", but if we are being real here, it's Philipp and Colton who are the guys to beat.
I hate seeing Hollie slip, but for whatever reason this song didn't seem to give her the momentum she needed. The nitpicking from the judges didn't help either. For Randy - there were no pitch problems in that performance. I have only heard a few Off key notes in last week's performance. Otherwise this girl's technical brilliance is unquestioned. Not that this means anything in the grand scheme of Idol. I just think she needed to change it up somehow this week. It's hard to take on a Carrie Underwood song and it may not have been well received by the viewers. I thought Joshua gave an amazing performance, but maybe he is kind of over the top with his gospel tinged r&b. I would like to think he shouldn't be quite this low, certainly not one step above Heejun.
I am going to be extremely upset if someone really good goes instead of Heejun. It's not a comedy show, it's a singing competition and he has struggled every single week. The judges giving him a standing ovation for not being crap last night, was beyond embarrassing. So now we are celebrating mediocrity? I hope not.
